definition: side of a ship or an aircraft

sentences.english: Repair leaking water pipe in starboard deck.
M/V Chang Li wishes to overtake on your starboard side.
It struck us on the starboard side almost amidships.
sentences.chinese: 它擊中了右舷船中幾乎我們。

sentences.english: He ordered all the port cannon to be heaved to starboard to counteract the list.
sentences.chinese: 他命令把左弦上所有的大炮移到右舷以抵消船的傾斜。

sentences.english: Make fast two tugs on starboard quarter.
sentences.chinese: 把右舷後面兩艘拖船綁牢。

sentences.english: We were sailing on starboard tack.
The aircraft can be fitted with a fixed aerial refuelling probe on the starboard side of the cockpit.
sentences.chinese: 戰機座艙的右舷可以安裝固定的空中加油受油頭。

sentences.english: Make fast tug(s) on starboard bow.
Starboard has undertaken all the necessary design refinements to the board.
sentences.chinese: 右舷進行了所有必要的設計改進意見。

sentences.english: Only starboard is shown, portside and starboard are symmetrical except as shown.
sentences.chinese: 圖示爲右舷結構，除註明外，左右舷對稱。

sentences.english: Sea anchor in starboard lifeboat rotted.
sentences.chinese: 右舷救生艇海錨生鏽腐爛。

sentences.english: Water pipe in starboard deck leaking.
M/V Treasure, keep wind on starboard bow.
sentences.chinese: “財富”船，把船操縱使風對右舷船頭。

sentences.english: Off to starboard a hand large enough to crush the boat was reaching up from the murky depths.
sentences.chinese: 在右舷邊一隻足以捏碎穿體的巨手從濁浪深處伸出。

sentences.english: Safety equipment on starboard deck have not been checked yet.
sentences.chinese: 右舷的安全設備還沒有檢查完。

definition: side of a ship or an aircraft
